result.execSummary:
The defendant Cathy L Kufahl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the two or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week - to the extent disability permits.

Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department. 
Court finds defendant is not entitled to any days jail credit if revoked.
Court approves transfer of probation to Lincoln County. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cathy L Kufahl

defendant.name: Kufahl, Cathy L

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:23 AM 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder.  Def appears in person with Atty James Kurszewski.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Forgery - Uttering/Repeater)>>AMEND to DC/Repeater pursuant to 947.01(1) and 939.62(1)(a). 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Atty Kurszewski makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week - to the extent disability permits; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds deft is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT approves transfer of probation to Lincoln County. 

Adj: 9:37 am
Plea hearing on April 15, 2014 at 09:30 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Status conference on April 22, 2014 at 08:40 am.
Final pre-trial on May 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Jury Trial on June 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 6, 2014 at 08:45 am.
Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.
